rev.diff:
Line 15: Line 15:
==Cable Television==
==Cable Television==
â
[[Image:MTV Logo 2010.png|190px|right]]
 
Seibert was [[MTV]]'s first [[creative director]] and guided its original voice and visual identity, creating hundreds of promotions, advertisements, and station IDs for the channel, and responsible for a rethinking of how television channels promoted themselves as "brands." He also commissioned and approved the mutating MTV logo, despite network executives objections to a logo that did not remain constant.<ref>[http://frankolinsky.com/mtvstory1.html "MTV Logo Story" Frank Olinsky dot com]</ref><ref>Seibert, Fred. [http://fredseibert.com/post/68774160/mtv-music-television-the-logo "MTV: Music Television, The Logo ''FredSeibert.com'']</ref> He led the team that developed one of the most famous advertising campaigns of the late 20th century, "I Want My MTV!"<ref>[http://fredseibert.com/tagged/IWMM "I Want My MTV!" Fred Seibert dot com]</ref>
Seibert was [[MTV]]'s first [[creative director]] and guided its original voice and visual identity, creating hundreds of promotions, advertisements, and station IDs for the channel, and responsible for a rethinking of how television channels promoted themselves as "brands." He also commissioned and approved the mutating MTV logo, despite network executives objections to a logo that did not remain constant.<ref>[http://frankolinsky.com/mtvstory1.html "MTV Logo Story" Frank Olinsky dot com]</ref><ref>Seibert, Fred. [http://fredseibert.com/post/68774160/mtv-music-television-the-logo "MTV: Music Television, The Logo ''FredSeibert.com'']</ref> He led the team that developed one of the most famous advertising campaigns of the late 20th century, "I Want My MTV!"<ref>[http://fredseibert.com/tagged/IWMM "I Want My MTV!" Fred Seibert dot com]</ref>
â
[[Image:Nickelodeon logo.svg|190px|right]]
 
In 1985, with partner [[Alan Goodman]] at Fred/Alan Inc., Seibert successfully overhauled the then-floundering children's cable channel [[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]], moving it from worst to first in the ratings in six months;<ref>[http://fredalan.org/post/66904670/from-worst-to-first-nickelodeon-network-ids-1984-1992 "From Worst to First"]</ref> and conceived and executed the [[Nick-at-Nite]] concept.<ref>[http://fredalan.org/post/88541284/the-first-oldies-television-network "The First Oldies Television Network"]</ref> Fred/Alan became the first branding company in television, working closely with [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]], [[The Movie Channel]], [[VH-1]], [[Lifetime]], and [[Comedy Central]].
In 1985, with partner [[Alan Goodman]] at Fred/Alan Inc., Seibert successfully overhauled the then-floundering children's cable channel [[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]], moving it from worst to first in the ratings in six months;<ref>[http://fredalan.org/post/66904670/from-worst-to-first-nickelodeon-network-ids-1984-1992 "From Worst to First"]</ref> and conceived and executed the [[Nick-at-Nite]] concept.<ref>[http://fredalan.org/post/88541284/the-first-oldies-television-network "The First Oldies Television Network"]</ref> Fred/Alan became the first branding company in television, working closely with [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]], [[The Movie Channel]], [[VH-1]], [[Lifetime]], and [[Comedy Central]].
